docs.snippet: ALBANY, May 26 -- Governor Dewey received today nineteen delegates of twelve Latin-American countries to the Inter-American Conference and made a prediction that the barriers of language differences between the United States and the Central and South...
docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, May 26 -- Governor Dewey received today nineteen delegates of twelve Latin-American countries to the Inter-American Conference and made a prediction that the barriers of language differences between the United States and the Central and South American nations "will soon dwindle, if not disappear entirely."

headline.main: KNITTING OF AMERICAS PREDICTED BY DEWEY; Governor Tells Latin Group of Dwindling Barriers

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 3 -- While the Argentine Government is preparing to celebrate the first anniversary of the June Fourth revolution of last year that delivered the nation to the mercies of military governments with dictatorial powers,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 3 -- While the Argentine Government is preparing to celebrate the first anniversary of the June Fourth revolution of last year that delivered the nation to the mercies of military governments with dictatorial powers, Argentine nationalists are threatening to hold an anti-Jewish demonstration if the one-day civil disobedience campaign scheduled for next Wednesday is put into effect.

docs.snippet: IN Uruguay's Department of Colonia, directly across the River Plata from Buenos Aires, is a district known as Nueva Helvecia, otherwise New Helvetia or New Switzerland, which was legally created a half-century ago as a "Colonia Suiza" or Swiss colony...
docs.lead_paragraph: IN Uruguay's Department of Colonia, directly across the River Plata from Buenos Aires, is a district known as Nueva Helvecia, otherwise New Helvetia or New Switzerland, which was legally created a half-century ago as a "Colonia Suiza" or Swiss colony of homes for Swiss settlers and their descendants.

docs.snippet: The pulse of the stock market slackened yesterday, for the second successive day, but prices held steady and the week ended with mixed price changes of slight importance. Trading yesterday was the narrowest in two weeks, with a turnover of 385,540...
docs.lead_paragraph: The pulse of the stock market slackened yesterday, for the second successive day, but prices held steady and the week ended with mixed price changes of slight importance. Trading yesterday was the narrowest in two weeks, with a turnover of 385,540 shares for the two-hour session on the Stock Exchange comparing with 415,300 shares traded a week before.

headline.main: STOCKS 'NEUTRAL' FOR DAY AND WEEK; Price Changes Unimportant in Final Slow Short Session -- Bonds Irregular

docs.snippet: A FIRST-DAY (May 15) cover received from Rio de Janeiro by Stamps Magazine brings two unheralded commemoratives issued by Brazil. One is a l-cruzeiro blue picturing a statue erected in 1943 of the Baron of Rio Branco. This item commemorates the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A FIRST-DAY (May 15) cover received from Rio de Janeiro by Stamps Magazine brings two unheralded commemoratives issued by Brazil. One is a l-cruzeiro blue picturing a statue erected in 1943 of the Baron of Rio Branco. This item commemorates the "Inauguracao do Monumento ao Barao do Rio Branco" (Inauguration of Monument to the Baron of Rio Branco).
